publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-870 Alex Johnstone: Expedition to the North Pole—That the Parliament congratulates Stonehaven man Charlie Paton, his colleague Alan Chambers and the other members of the expeditionary team on their achievement in becoming the first Britons to walk unsupported to the North Pole, an accomplishment which reflects highly on the individuals concerned and the Royal Marines Condor unit based in Arbroath.
S1M-870 Expedition to the North Pole (lodged on 17 May 2000) Phil Gallie*, Shona Robison*

S1M-870 Alex Johnstone: Expedition to the North Pole—That the Parliament congratulates Stonehaven man Charlie Paton, his colleague Alan Chambers and the other members of the expeditionary team on their achievement in becoming the first Britons to walk unsupported to the North Pole, an accomplishment which reflects highly on the individuals concerned and the Royal Marines Condor unit based in Arbroath. Supported by: Phil Gallie, Shona Robison
S1M-870 Expedition to the North Pole (lodged on 17 May 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Andrew Wilson*
S1M-870 Expedition to the North Pole (lodged on 17 May 2000) Brian Adam*
S1M-870 Expedition to the North Pole (lodged on 17 May 2000) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-870 Alex Johnstone: Expedition to the North Pole—That the Parliament congratulates Stonehaven man Charlie Paton, his colleague Alan Chambers and the other members of the expeditionary team on their achievement in becoming the first Britons to walk unsupported to the North Pole, an accomplishment which reflects highly on the individuals concerned and the Royal Marines Condor unit based in Arbroath. Supported by: Phil Gallie, Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie
S1M-870 Expedition to the North Pole (lodged on 17 May 2000) Mr Keith Harding*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Mr David Davidson*, Alex Neil*
S1M-870 Expedition to the North Pole (lodged on 17 May 2000) Ben Wallace*

S1M-870 Alex Johnstone: Expedition to the North Pole-That the Parliament congratulates Stonehaven man Charlie Paton, his colleague Alan Chambers and the other members of the expeditionary team on their achievement in becoming the first Britons to walk unsupported to the North Pole, an accomplishment which reflects highly on the individuals concerned and the Royal Marines Condor unit based in Arbroath. Supported by: Phil Gallie, Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr David Davidson, Alex Neil, Ben Wallace
S1M-870 Expedition to the North Pole (lodged on 17 May 2000) Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-870 Alex Johnstone: Expedition to the North Pole-That the Parliament congratulates Stonehaven man Charlie Paton, his colleague Alan Chambers and the other members of the expeditionary team on their achievement in becoming the first Britons to walk unsupported to the North Pole, an accomplishment which reflects highly on the individuals concerned and the Royal Marines Condor unit based in Arbroath. Supported by: Phil Gallie, Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr David Davidson, Alex Neil, Ben Wallace, Mr Brian Monteith

S1M-870 Alex Johnstone: Expedition to the North Pole—That the Parliament congratulates Stonehaven man Charlie Paton, his colleague Alan Chambers and the other members of the expeditionary team on their achievement in becoming the first Britons to walk unsupported to the North Pole, an accomplishment which reflects highly on the individuals concerned and the Royal Marines Condor unit based in Arbroath. Supported by: Phil Gallie, Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr David Davidson, Alex Neil, Ben Wallace, Mr Brian Monteith

Supported by: Phil Gallie, Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Andrew Wilson, Brian Adam, Donald Gorrie, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr David Davidson, Alex Neil, Ben Wallace, Mr Brian Monteith
